alert.note: Alert for Alamosa; Rio Grande; Saguache (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued April 03 at 2:38PM MDT until April 03 at 4:30PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pueblo has issued a * Dust Storm Warning for... Northwestern Alamosa County in southeastern Colorado... East central Rio Grande County in south central Colorado... Southeastern Saguache County in central Colorado... * Until 430 PM MDT. * At 236 PM MDT, a plume of dust was along a line extending from 7 miles southeast of Moffat to 6 miles north of Great Sand Dunes to 6 miles east of San Luis Lake, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Less than a quarter mile visibility with damaging wind in excess of 60 mph. SOURCE...Satellite. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. Locations impacted include... Crestone, Hooper, Great Sand Dunes, Mosca and San Luis Lake. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Dust storms lead to dangerous driving conditions with visibility reduced to near zero. If driving, avoid dust storms if possible. If caught in one, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into a dust storm. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
